org.fujion.plotly.plot

Class PlotPie

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fujion.ancillary.Options
      • org.fujion.plotly.plot.PlotOptions
        • org.fujion.plotly.plot.PlotPie
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OptionMap.IOptionMapConverter, IClientTransform

    public class PlotPie
extends PlotOptions
    Options for pie chart plot.

    A pie chart is a circular graphic which is divided into slices to illustrate numerical proportion.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class org.fujion.plotly.plot.PlotOptions

        PlotOptions.VisibileEnum

    • Field Detail

      • direction

        @Option
public PolarDirectionEnum direction
        Specifies the direction at which succeeding sectors follow one another.

        Default: COUNTERCLOCKWISE

      • dlabel

        @Option
public Integer dlabel
        The label step. See label0 for more info.

        Default: 1

      • domain_x

        @Option(value="domain.x")
public int[] domain_x
        The horizontal domain of this pie trace (in plot fraction).

        Default: [0,1]

      • domain_y

        @Option(value="domain.y")
public int[] domain_y
        The vertical domain of this pie trace (in plot fraction).

        Default: [0,1]

      • hole

        @Option
public Double hole
        The fraction of the radius to cut out of the pie. Use this to make a donut chart.

        Default: 0

      • hovertext$array

        @Option(value="hovertext")
public String[] hovertext$array
        Hover text elements associated with each sector.items are mapped in order of this trace's sectors. To be seen, trace "hoverinfo" must contain a "text" flag.

      • hovertext$string

        @Option(value="hovertext")
public String hovertext$string
        Alternative to an array, the same string appears for all data points.

      • insidetextfont

        @Option
public final FontOptions insidetextfont
        The font used for "textinfo" lying inside the pie.

      • label0

        @Option
public Integer label0
        Alternate to "labels". Builds a numeric set of labels. Use with "dlabel" where "label0" is the starting label and "dlabel" the step.

        Default: 0

      • labels

        @Option
public String[] labels
        The sector labels. If "labels" entries are duplicated, we sum associated "values" or simply count occurrences if "values" is not provided. For other array attributes (including color) we use the first non-empty entry among all occurrences of the label.

      • marker_colors

        @Option(value="marker.colors")
public String[] marker_colors
        The color of each sector of this pie chart. If not specified, the default trace color set is used to pick the sector colors.

      • marker_line_color

        @Option(value="marker.line.color")
public String marker_line_color
        The color of the line enclosing each sector.

        Default: "#444"

      • marker_line_width

        @Option(value="marker.line.width")
public Integer marker_line_width
        The width (in px) of the line enclosing each sector.

        Default: 0

      • outsidetextfont

        @Option
public final FontOptions outsidetextfont
        The font used for "textinfo" lying outside the pie.

      • pull$array

        @Option(value="pull")
public double[] pull$array
        The fraction of larger radius to pull the sectors out from the center. Use an array to highlight one or more slices.

      • pull$number

        @Option(value="pull")
public Double pull$number
        Alternative form for pull. The fraction of larger radius to pull the sectors out from the center. Pulls all slices apart from each other equally.

      • rotation

        @Option
public Integer rotation
        Instead of the first slice starting at 12 o"clock, rotate to some other angle.

        Constraints: ≥-360 and ≤360

        Default: 0

      • scalegroup

        @Option
public String scalegroup
        If there are multiple pies that should be sized according to their totals, link them by providing a non-empty group id here shared by every trace in the same group.

      • sort

        @Option
public Boolean sort
        Determines whether or not the sectors are reordered from largest to smallest.

        Default: true

      • text

        @Option
public String[] text
        Text elements associated with each sector. If trace "textinfo" contains a "text" flag, these elements will seen on the chart. If trace "hoverinfo" contains a "text" flag and "hovertext" is not set, these elements will be seen in the hover labels.

      • textfont

        @Option
public final FontOptions textfont
        The font used for "textinfo".

      • textinfo

        @Option
public String textinfo
        Determines which trace information appear on the graph. Any combination of "label", "text", "value", "percent" joined with a "+" OR "none". examples: "label", "text", "label+text", "label+text+value", "none".

      • textposition

        @Option
public TextRegionEnum textposition
        Specifies the location of the "textinfo".

      • values

        @Option
public Object[] values
        The values of the sectors of this pie chart. If omitted, we count occurrences of each label.

      • values$number

        @Option(value="values")
public double[] values$number
        The values of the sectors of this pie chart. If omitted, we count occurrences of each label.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlotPie

        public PlotPie()
